etymology.description: Semantic: 女(女) (nǚ, "woman") + Phonetic: 亭(亭) (tíng, "pavilion") = grace associated with women -> graceful, elegant
etymology.interpretation: 婷(婷) (tíng, "graceful; elegant") combines 女(女) (nǚ, "woman") to suggest feminine grace with 亭(亭) (tíng, "pavilion") as the phonetic element. This combination conveys the idea of elegance typically associated with women.

examples.chinese: 小婷在晚会上表演舞蹈(小婷在晚會上表演舞蹈)。
examples.pinyin: Xiǎo tíng zài wǎnhuì shàng biǎoyǎn wǔdǎo.
examples.english: Little Ting performed a dance at the party.

examples.chinese: 那位女子仪态端庄(那位女子儀態端莊)，风姿婷丽(風姿婷麗)。
examples.pinyin: Nà wèi nǚzǐ yítài duānzhuāng, fēngzī tínglì.
examples.english: That woman has a dignified bearing and graceful charm.

examples.chinese: 她的笑容温婉婷雅(她的笑容溫婉婷雅)。
examples.english: Her smile is gentle and elegantly graceful.
